--
Evenia,
All of the excuses for which you didn't bother to present justifications prior
to the current issues will buy you nothing. I raised issues in plenty of time
for you to justify caving into ather Jammoa who has lost a tremendous amount of
credibility and you also allowed him to back-stab me and SEAS. So how do you
consider that to be very supportive of someone you ... uh considered to be a
friend. None of what you claim has any credible sensibilities. So how did you
think I was to be able to put up the Transmitter, the Recharging Station, The
Watchtower in 777? Oh yeah, we can certainly afford the modules but LIBS and
SEAS agreed to work together and very little out there yields much income so
what you are trying to use as a poor excuse has no basis whatsoever. So when
LIBS quits, then good riddance. We won't have a Rift Inserter but we shall
survive without you being the two-faced and dishonest person you are. No thanks!
As for Cats, Melinda blows with the wind. If she thinks it's ok with the
bullshitters out there, she's cool with it. As you are now. Otherwise, it's not
so I don't trust her as far as I can toss this pull tab that I have in my
backpack for some silly reason!
Yeah now you've cozyed up to Melinda you will say anything and it's not
surprising.
You have lost all of my respect Evenia. I sure did admire you when you stuck up
for what was right rather than what someone like Ather Jammoa wanted because he
is excessively jealous of me for reasons that I would rather not relate right
now but mostly because of reasons of his own undoing. So it's this game of I've
fallen, so I'll pull down anyone who seems to possess anything akin to what I
once had. So it's been nice knowing you Evenia. Ifever SEAS is able to
participate with stations again, I won't give you access to anything we own.
You've already betrayed us. You are not trustworthy. If seas must put up their
own income-producing Temporary Space Stations, we shall and we've been planning
to do so.
Lily Kaise

lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a black plastic
tray of spider chow, a compact white refrigerator, an insulated black cooler, a
robotic chef named Nellie, Purr the humanoid service robot, and a Tardick lizard
named Asteria here.

ftl chetumal
who
There appear to be 6 pilots recently active.
The communicator network detects:
Angel Martin  (A)
Shule Elemmire, Phoenix Dissident  (A) [m]
Cadet Anny Rain  (L) [c]
Nicolette Lawrence  (L)
Chase Marshall  (L)
Ali Candan  (L)
Additionally, there are 11 pilots who appear to have their communicators on but
have not recently been active.
Final total: 17 pilots.
Want to know if anyone's relaxing in a public venue? Check WHERE!
What was once a feature of interstellar geography is now the name of an
alliance, and the heart of Fringe space can be found past this gateway. The tiny
station of Nuevo Laredo stands guard here.
The planet of Chetumal floats before you here, the richest planet among the
Fringe Worlds, although that isn't saying a lot.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Chetumal in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation order
is entered."
Via general sector communication, Chetumal transmits, "Greetings, Deadly Strike!
Welcome to Chetumal Orbit!"

l
[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.

Subject: Re: Say no to Outccord
Author: Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident
Posted: 12:50 16 September 2317 GST
--
Melinda, you apparently missed my prior post. Sometimes we can't be in more than
one place. I am just not able to work as much as I used to and if I'm here
during the early mornings at times at all, it's for a very short time. Last week
was one of those weeks when I was available on Monday, not long on Tuesday and
then not until the weekend. So below is what I said.
I'm proud of you all and appreciate everyone's support and efforts to pressure
the AEU Government and in our opposition to Outccord. The average AEU citizen
needs to become more aware and this is what it takes! Sadly, due to
circumstances beyond my control, i couldn't be there.
Unfortunately, i was unable to be on hand last week with the exception that I
was available on September 4th when eli said that this protest would begin that
day.
i apologize for putting up the Beacon in 777 but i was concerned that Johann
would be annoyed and it has nothing to do with personal preference.
i'm adding that Johann has called me before when I wasn't available to put up a
station. He denies that he was annoyed but that's not how his tone sounded so
that's just how it was.
I most definitely abhor what the WORST administration is doing to the entirety
of AEU citizens and especially to those who are from other Worlds and
Territories.
i was caught in the middle of wanting to be there for others and especially less
experienced pilots which was the original intent of Artifact Alpha 777 I only
had a little time and I couldn't be in both places at one time.
I certainly will continue to fight the fight to debunk Outccord when I am able
to. I will have time off and on over the weekend so if anything in the way of
new protest activities are organized, I'll be there!
I'm proud of you all and appreciate everyone's support and efforts to pressure
the AEU Government and in our opposition to Outccord. The average AEU citizen
needs to become more aware and this is what it takes! Sadly, due to
circumstances beyond my control, i couldn't be there last week.
i have done as much as I can to oppose Outccord. I have sponsored signs in
Providence and in Riverway. I have attended Eli's broadcasts whenever I could
and I have chased away Merchants when I could and will continue to do so. If
another protest occurs, if I am available, I will be there. If not,then just as
many other AEU pilots weren't on hand for their own reasons, then this is how it
is.
I apologize again but I but you also jumptd to a hasty conclusion based upon
what Ather said without knowing what i was really doing regarding opposition to
Outccord. Eli spoke up for me as well. So I know you will do what you will do
regardless of what I say.
If SEAS is never allowed on stations again, we shall build our own and yes move
on. We are qualified to obtain sufficient modules to build all of the
income-producing stations including Xenology. We would prefer to work with
others but when we have stopped Outccord, then if you all don't want to be
reasonable, then we'll manage. So in order to prevent the competition that you
all don't like, then common sense says we ought to work together.
--

7), (12, 13, 5), (12, 7, 19), (1, 16, 10), (14, 17, 13), (8, 16, 15), (5, 11,

Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident glides in from the east.
vector e
You make a selection on the AutoVector control board.
The starship transitions into another sector.

transmits, "Current riftflow conditions are 2131 light-minutes per second from
Galactic Southsoutheast and Down."

navigation order is entered."

Strike! Welcome to The Torus!"

A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: The Torus (Dock Alpha).
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident presses a button on the FTL drive tracer control
board.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident glances at the resulting list of recent FTL drive
traces.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident asks, "Want to go to new earth and see if we can
find any merchants?"
The ship's computer automatically requests docking clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "We detect you to be an AEU ship,
Deadly Strike. The EAOS welcomes you under the non-aggression pact."
The computer sounds a notification indicating that the ship has been fully
charged.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident sits down on an overstuffed dark green chair.
power
You pull a large lever towards you.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.
Your ship 'Deadly Strike' has been automatically moved into a garage.
cuddle lily
You cuddle up to Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident cuddles up to you.
[Tactical Communication] Ali Candan transmits, "Beacons?"
[Tactical Communication] Michael Kennedy transmits, "Sure."
wrap lily
You wrap your arms around Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident, pulling her close.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident navigates her metallic gold touch einrophone to a
text-heavy application and peers at the screen.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident says, "Heh you lyer Melinda. Yeah one person,
Ather Jamo."
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident says, "Eli took up for me and I wasn't pointing at
him."
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident stands up from an overstuffed dark green chair.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident kisses you.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident glides out.
l
[Starship "Deadly Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, a small hot beverage
dispenser, a small hot coffee dispenser, and an overstuffed dark green chair
here.
You can go east, southeast, and out.
(You are sitting on an overstuffed dark green chair.)
[AEU | 10: Conquest Status] An AEU pilot corps liaison transmits, "Looks like
we've got some things going, but we haven't met any performance goals yet!"
out
You scramble to your feet.
[Starship "Deadly Strike"; Airlock]
You can go out and enter into the ship.
out
You exit the ship.
[The Torus; Garage]
You can go up.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a black plastic
tray of spider chow, a compact white refrigerator, an insulated black cooler, a
robotic chef named Nellie, and Purr the humanoid service robot here.
You can go south and out.

Subject: Re: Say no to Outccord
Author: Morris Corlew
Posted: 14:40 16 September 2317 GST
--
Lily, I think the point you're missing here is that we all want you to just take
responsibility. Stop pawning it off on Eve (who had literaly nothing to do with
it and doesn't deserve your vitriol), Johann, Melinda, Ather, and whoever else.
All it would have taken was, "I messed up, I'm sorry." When I was a boy I was
taught about something called natural consquences. When we do something there
are always consequences. Some kids get whooped, but my parents believed in what
we do making its own consequences. What's happening now is exactly that. We're
not punishing you. You did this to yourself. And if you can own up to what you
did instead of blaming everyone else, it'll go a long way. You may not have sent
me one of your nastygrams, but I got to read it and read what was on the board.
Take some responsibility. Stop trying to spread the shit around and just admit
you screwed up. It would go a lot farther than maybe you think. Everything we do
has consequences, and you can't blame the word for what happens. Learn from your
mistakes. You'll be a lot happier that way.
--

Subject: Re: Say no to Outccord
Author: Melinda Michaels
Posted: 05:17 16 September 2317 GST
--
Hey there,
I just wanted to explain this station thing for Lily. I chose to make this
public because she took her rant public.
Lily, while most everyone was at the protest, something important for your
alliance, you were building stations. Some of us even took rock shots in the
heads by your all's crazy antipeople groups. So, while I don't care and don't
need to hear the why for's, you just weren't there, it's done.
An apology would have worked out nicely rather than trying to place blame on
others, which seems to be your pattern. Ather was very let down and upset by
your not being as at the protest, were we all. He threw it out there for you not
to be on stations and we all agreed. So, if you want back in on stations, this
is how I feel it works, put a real apology up on the public boards and we'll
talk to Ather. Yes, that's me making a demand but I don't think I am asking
much.
And one more thing, stop blaming everybody for what went wrong, it happened, you
didn't make it, suck it up and try to move on.
Melinda

Subject: Re: Say no to Outccord
Author: Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident
Posted: 12:50 16 September 2317 GST
--
Melinda, you apparently missed my prior post. Sometimes we can't be in more than
one place. I am just not able to work as much as I used to and if I'm here
during the early mornings at times at all, it's for a very short time. Last week
was one of those weeks when I was available on Monday, not long on Tuesday and
then not until the weekend. So below is what I said.
I'm proud of you all and appreciate everyone's support and efforts to pressure
the AEU Government and in our opposition to Outccord. The average AEU citizen
needs to become more aware and this is what it takes! Sadly, due to
circumstances beyond my control, i couldn't be there.
Unfortunately, i was unable to be on hand last week with the exception that I
was available on September 4th when eli said that this protest would begin that
day.
i apologize for putting up the Beacon in 777 but i was concerned that Johann
would be annoyed and it has nothing to do with personal preference.
i'm adding that Johann has called me before when I wasn't available to put up a
station. He denies that he was annoyed but that's not how his tone sounded so
that's just how it was.
I most definitely abhor what the WORST administration is doing to the entirety
of AEU citizens and especially to those who are from other Worlds and
Territories.
i was caught in the middle of wanting to be there for others and especially less
experienced pilots which was the original intent of Artifact Alpha 777 I only
had a little time and I couldn't be in both places at one time.
I certainly will continue to fight the fight to debunk Outccord when I am able
to. I will have time off and on over the weekend so if anything in the way of
new protest activities are organized, I'll be there!
I'm proud of you all and appreciate everyone's support and efforts to pressure
the AEU Government and in our opposition to Outccord. The average AEU citizen
needs to become more aware and this is what it takes! Sadly, due to
circumstances beyond my control, i couldn't be there last week.
i have done as much as I can to oppose Outccord. I have sponsored signs in
Providence and in Riverway. I have attended Eli's broadcasts whenever I could
and I have chased away Merchants when I could and will continue to do so. If
another protest occurs, if I am available, I will be there. If not,then just as
many other AEU pilots weren't on hand for their own reasons, then this is how it
is.
I apologize again but I but you also jumptd to a hasty conclusion based upon
what Ather said without knowing what i was really doing regarding opposition to
Outccord. Eli spoke up for me as well. So I know you will do what you will do
regardless of what I say.
If SEAS is never allowed on stations again, we shall build our own and yes move
on. We are qualified to obtain sufficient modules to build all of the
income-producing stations including Xenology. We would prefer to work with
others but when we have stopped Outccord, then if you all don't want to be
reasonable, then we'll manage. So in order to prevent the competition that you
all don't like, then common sense says we ought to work together.
--

Subject: Say no to Outccord
Author: Rogue Pilot Eli Grey
Posted: 19:55  5 September 2317 GST
--
Citizens of humanity, Outccord is currently on hold but it must be stopped
completely
If the Union pulls out of the Accord, it will weaken our best fighting chance
against the alien threats that want to destroy us
President Best wants people to think that the Union doesn't need the rest of
humanity, he even wants to kick folks out just for being born in other alliances
the Union pilots have been trying, but the one thing we haven't done is asked
the rest of humanity for help, or to show that they want the Union to stay in
the Accord
so, today starting at 20:00 we will begin protesting outside of the old AEU
headquarters, straight north from the New Phoenix spaceport
this is your chance, as members of other alliances, to come out and show the
citizens that you don't want the Accord to lose the support of the Union
Please come and join us, help show the people of the Union that we all stand
together
i will likely be staying at the site for a couple of days, I do not however
expect anyone else to do so. 
We can end this madness together if we try
--

Subject: assistant temp station coordinator
Author: Melinda Michaels
Posted: 07:16  8 September 2317 GST
--
So, keeping all these temp stations and builders together might seem easy but at
times it can be a bit of a job.
I am looking for an assistant coordinator. Their job would be as follows:
1. stand in coordinator in the event of my absence for any reason. This would
entail both long and short absences from work.
2. Have the ability to discuss decisions that need to be made with me so that I
don't miss a possible solution.
3. Be willing to put personal views of others aside for the continued station
building work relationship of the organizations.
If you are interested, send me a letter by September 12th. Please explain why
you are interested and your station building experience whether it be none,
minimal, mid-range or extensive.
One final note, I do not usually just make big decisions on my own. Getting a
feel for what other organizations think is how I have decided to run the show.
You must also be willing to do that.
Thanks in advance,
Melinda
--

Subject: Re: Say no to Outccord
Author: Morris Corlew
Posted: 14:40 16 September 2317 GST
--
Lily, I think the point you're missing here is that we all want you to just take
responsibility. Stop pawning it off on Eve (who had literaly nothing to do with
it and doesn't deserve your vitriol), Johann, Melinda, Ather, and whoever else.
All it would have taken was, "I messed up, I'm sorry." When I was a boy I was
taught about something called natural consquences. When we do something there
are always consequences. Some kids get whooped, but my parents believed in what
we do making its own consequences. What's happening now is exactly that. We're
not punishing you. You did this to yourself. And if you can own up to what you
did instead of blaming everyone else, it'll go a long way. You may not have sent
me one of your nastygrams, but I got to read it and read what was on the board.
Take some responsibility. Stop trying to spread the shit around and just admit
you screwed up. It would go a lot farther than maybe you think. Everything we do
has consequences, and you can't blame the word for what happens. Learn from your
mistakes. You'll be a lot happier that way.
--

Lily.
I am going to be quite blunt. the letters you sent to Evenia crossed a major
line. We are professionals, not junior high school students. Decisions made in
professional situations are not indicative of personal feelings towards
individuals. If you want to be angry at me, Evenia told me what she did on
Ather's behest, and I approved it. You can send me all the hate mail you want
because after I see the first one isn't worth reading, I'll just go camping and
roast marshmallows with the rest.
Regardless of future involvement by anybody, 777 will remain up for new pilots
to salvage and artifact, and Allied Libertarians will always be involved. If you
wish to go your own way, you are of course free to do so, but if Seas ever
wishes to work with Lib again, there will be an appology made to my station
coordinator, and a promise to at least be able to conduct civil discourse.
all the Best,
Johann Schraft, Allied Libertarians Founder

FTL Interalliance Communications Network

Subject: Re: Say no to Outccord
Author: Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident
Posted: 15:59 16 September 2317 GST
--
Morris,
You fail to recognize that theres a difference between natural consequences
and peoples choice in the way they react to something. I am sorry for feeling
the urgency that there was a beacon that had expired. It's a natural reaction to
feel the urgency that others depend on a beacon or otherwise and to rush into
action.
I don't know how else I can express that I'm sorry for making this choice. You
all do have your own agenda though as you would have recognized this in lieu of
my other very dedicated efforts to oppose Outccord and to express my outrage
towards the violence towards non-citizens of the AEU.
I apologize for chosing to do what I did but I felt caught in the middle of
feeling responsible for both situations. I didn't even know that there was a
protest going on as well until eli spoke to me over the AEU channel and I was
already en route. Yes I could have turned around as well.
--
[1] Previous
[2] Return
[3] Reply
[4] Quit
--
Enter your selection:
3
Enter the body of your post.
[Type lines of input; use `.' to end or `@abort' to abort the command.]
Wow! What did I come back to? As AEU pilots hopefully knew, I have not been able
to be very active for about a week and a half. I understand that misunderstandin
gs happen and apparently, some drama took place while I was unable to be at work
consistently.
From my understanding, a multi-day protest against Outcoord took place on New
Earth sometime around the 4th in which civilian pilots from more than one
alliance participated. I applaud those who were available and took the time to
take a stand against such a terrible thing. Had I been available, I would have
enthusiastically joined those in the protest.
I would like to emphasize that from the very beginning of all of this, going as
far back as the first broadcast, taking a stand against Outccord has been a
highly encouraged, but ultimately volunteer affair. I have chosen to stand with
my fellow pilots and have attended every event that I could, including going so
far as to self-destruct my transport over New Earth. Since then, I have honored
the strike and continued to join Eli and other fellow pilots in broadcasts and
alike. I am deeply sorry that I was unable to attend the protest.
Now, I was not there during the protest and therefore am unable to give a
firsthand account as to who did what. However, it seems that Lily, being short
on time, made a choice to go put up a beacon out at 777. This choice, triggered
a string of events that Morris calls "natural consequences."
And here is where I would like to share my two credits if I may. First of all,
there is a difference between "natural consequences" and the choice that people
make in reacting to a situation. For example, if one touches a hot stove,
obviously getting hurt is a "natural consequence". However, how people choose to
react around you is their choice and only theirs. For example, the AEU has been
on strike now for over a month. Is it a "natural consequence" that the AEU
government has not really responded to our demands? No, I say that it is their
choice.
*
Despite common belief, when someone is asked to do something, ultimately it is
the person's choice to agree to their request or not. We are all sentient beings
with the ability to make choices. It is the ability to choose that we fought for
against the outsiders and cherish daily. When Eli asked me to stand with him
during broadcasts, it was ultimately my choice to join him or not. Think about
that any time anyone asks you to do something. Whether or not you take the
action that they requested is solely your responsibility. We are all ultimately
responsible for our own individual actions. Saying that someone asked me to do
it and failing to take responsibility for following through with that person's
request does not relieve you of that responsibility.
I understand that Ather was very upset that Lily was unable or in the opinion of
the people, chose not to attend the protest. I'm not saying he was wrong to feel
that way. I understand that it was an important event. However, Lily did offer
an explanation and did express that she wishes she could have been there.
However, not allowing SEAS to participate in stations, not only punishes Lily,
but also punishes all of the rest of the members of SEAS. People who have been
very supportive of the AEU's actions to take a stand against Outccord. While I
understand that many of you were upset that Lily didn't attend the protest, how
you react is still your choice to make and for now, it seems your choice is to
punish all of SEAS, including me. This went from a personal issue and became an
org issue. Seems rather unfair to me.
I have always been as helpful as I can be to all of you and though I have been
angered by some of the actions people have taken in the past, I have always
strived to be understanding towards all of you. We all make mistakes and I'm
sure all of us can do a better job apologizing when we offend people, but as
someone once told me, the only way someone can offend you is if you let them. 
*
*
*
*
Having said all of that, let's just drop this issue and quit beating a dead
horse into the ground. Believe me, there have been times in the past when I
could have created just as much drama over something that someone did to me, but
again, my choice not to and I accept that choice. So, how you all respond is up
to you and only you. Take care all of you and fly safe.
*
*
*
*
Shule
*
.
--
Subject: Re: Say no to Outccord
--
Wow! What did I come back to? As AEU pilots hopefully knew, I have not been able
to be very active for about a week and a half. I understand that misunderstandin
gs happen and apparently, some drama took place while I was unable to be at work
consistently.
From my understanding, a multi-day protest against Outcoord took place on New
Earth sometime around the 4th in which civilian pilots from more than one
alliance participated. I applaud those who were available and took the time to
take a stand against such a terrible thing. Had I been available, I would have
enthusiastically joined those in the protest.
I would like to emphasize that from the very beginning of all of this, going as
far back as the first broadcast, taking a stand against Outccord has been a
highly encouraged, but ultimately volunteer affair. I have chosen to stand with
my fellow pilots and have attended every event that I could, including going so
far as to self-destruct my transport over New Earth. Since then, I have honored
the strike and continued to join Eli and other fellow pilots in broadcasts and
alike. I am deeply sorry that I was unable to attend the protest.
Now, I was not there during the protest and therefore am unable to give a
firsthand account as to who did what. However, it seems that Lily, being short
on time, made a choice to go put up a beacon out at 777. This choice, triggered
a string of events that Morris calls "natural consequences."
And here is where I would like to share my two credits if I may. First of all,
there is a difference between "natural consequences" and the choice that people
make in reacting to a situation. For example, if one touches a hot stove,
obviously getting hurt is a "natural consequence". However, how people choose to
react around you is their choice and only theirs. For example, the AEU has been
on strike now for over a month. Is it a "natural consequence" that the AEU
government has not really responded to our demands? No, I say that it is their
choice.
Despite common belief, when someone is asked to do something, ultimately it is
the person's choice to agree to their request or not. We are all sentient beings
with the ability to make choices. It is the ability to choose that we fought for
against the outsiders and cherish daily. When Eli asked me to stand with him
during broadcasts, it was ultimately my choice to join him or not. Think about
that any time anyone asks you to do something. Whether or not you take the
action that they requested is solely your responsibility. We are all ultimately
responsible for our own individual actions. Saying that someone asked me to do
it and failing to take responsibility for following through with that person's
request does not relieve you of that responsibility.
I understand that Ather was very upset that Lily was unable or in the opinion of
the people, chose not to attend the protest. I'm not saying he was wrong to feel
that way. I understand that it was an important event. However, Lily did offer
an explanation and did express that she wishes she could have been there.
However, not allowing SEAS to participate in stations, not only punishes Lily,
but also punishes all of the rest of the members of SEAS. People who have been
very supportive of the AEU's actions to take a stand against Outccord. While I
understand that many of you were upset that Lily didn't attend the protest, how
you react is still your choice to make and for now, it seems your choice is to
punish all of SEAS, including me. This went from a personal issue and became an
org issue. Seems rather unfair to me.
I have always been as helpful as I can be to all of you and though I have been
angered by some of the actions people have taken in the past, I have always
strived to be understanding towards all of you. We all make mistakes and I'm
sure all of us can do a better job apologizing when we offend people, but as
someone once told me, the only way someone can offend you is if you let them. 
Having said all of that, let's just drop this issue and quit beating a dead
horse into the ground. Believe me, there have been times in the past when I
could have created just as much drama over something that someone did to me, but
again, my choice not to and I accept that choice. So, how you all respond is up
to you and only you. Take care all of you and fly safe.
Shule
--

Subject: Death and Avarice is calling all pilots. Preliminary post
Author: Johann Schraft
Posted: 15:23 16 September 2317 GST
--
Hello all! allied Libertarians is planning an artifacting trip out to a virgin
field called Death and Avarice. Departure date is still up in the air, but plan
on in the next couple weeks.
Here's what we know so far.
the field is out down Feng Wo way, and is most likely alien artifacts. Nissi is
kindly providing Future Crimes for ship transport, and Lib will be setting up
the beacon, watchtower, and recharger. We will be artifacting close to two
weeks, plus travel time add on a possible week for a total of three weeks gone.
Procedures are as follows.
Those who can, bring your smallest artifacting ship. If you have siteseers or
runabouts those are preferred. On the watchtower, if you encounter qi clan
ships, don't fire at them unless they lock on you or another pilot.
It's possible some people won't have the requirements for a ship out there, so
if you are willing to take someone, please do so.
AEU people, you are welcome to come if you so desire, although we know you are
striking, and if you feel it violates the spirit of the strike, you should by
all means stay back.
If you are interested in going, please either send me a letter, or reply to this
post because I'll probably forget it if you tell me verbally.
If I am forgetting anything, please use common sense, don't ping, and I will
update you as we finalize the departure date and any other things to expect.
thanks,
The Allied Libertarians Team
--

[The Torus; The Arboretum]
Between the windows on each side of this section of corridor are two arches
perhaps twenty feet high, each one containing a small green tree with lacy
leaves. The trees grow from beneath the floor, their slender, dark brown trunks
emerging from decorative circular grates. While most of the illumination here is
provided by the lighted walls, tiny star-like lights twinkle from the boughs of
the trees. Three doorways on the outer side of the corridor lead to small shops,
one selling souvenirs, the second identified by a brightly lit twinkling sign as
'Holiday Ornamentation,' and the third named 'The Ontological Felo,' which has
articles of oddly shaped clothing in a small display window next to the doorway.
You can go northeast and southwest.

[Starship "Happy"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A small rectangular transparisteel viewport provides a view out
the front of the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for
the large starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the
viewport is the main control board, providing essential functions like the
shipwide power lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up
and folded back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses
overhead as needed. There is not really enough room for anyone to comfortably
stand here; there is only room for the pilot's chair and the controls arranged
around it. Most of the space aboard the small shuttle is dedicated to cargo.
Lights overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at The Torus; Dock Beta.
You see a soft oval mauve rug with a luxuriously deep pile and thick gold

with a soft sky blue brocade pillow with thick gold fringe on it, Meow the
little calico CatBot, and a glossy sapphire blue ceramic felo chow bowl here.

read book
An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades                                      
  Page 11
Shuttles:
One-person runabout (gotten from SSN)
Point requirements: none.
Weapons: two turrets
Stock cargo: 10000 units.
Stock charge: 8 hours.
While this ship is findable on SSN, you can if you're so inclined check to see
if other pilots might have tickets that they might be willing to part with,
saving you from needing to watch SSn until tickets redemable for the ship come
up on sale! That is one of the reasons I didn't put a price for this ship down,
though expect to pay a minimum of 170 million EAOS credits for it. More if you
get your ticket from another pilot. Once you have your ticket, just redeem it at
any ship store. This ship is attachable to a tactical platform like other
shuttles. However, the bonuses it gives to the tactical platform are presently
unknown. It also does seem to get a minor max drive velocity bonus.
One-Person Interplanetary Shuttle 5,000,000.00 (Old Earth in the city of
Cherise)
U-1A UNITED FREIGHT D'INTSEC INTERPLANETARY SHUTTLE
Class: Shuttle
Requirements: 100 industry points
Model number: U-1a                      Designation: Interplanetary Shuttle
Turret hardpoints: 0                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 17500        Standard battery hours: 6
Docking bay size required: 23
This ship is mainly useful for intermediate levels of trading. You cannot
salvage with it, but you can attach it to a tactical platform if you're so
inclined. Note: this ship does not have an FTL drive.
One-Person Luxury Sightseer 105,000,000.00 (any hermes branch)
H-07 HERMES COMMUNICATIONS TWO PASSENGER LUXURY SIGHTSEER
Class: Shuttle
Requirements: 2000 industry points      1750 exploration points
Model number: H-07                      Designation: Luxury Sightseer
Turret hardpoints: 2                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 2500         Standard battery hours: 18
Docking bay size required: 5
You might be asking yourselves, "Why didn't Ather leave this in the passenger
ships section?" Wel, this ship is only capable of delivering two passengers, so
it really isn't in a specific tier level because of that, and because of the
number of required points. However, it is equipped with exploration-grade
sensors, which would make it a fairly useful ship for exploration, especially if
one wishes to install an impeller on the thing. Even better, it can be hooked up
to a tactical platform, adding benefits to that particular ship in its own ways.
So, this ship has uses that would probably be geared towards anything other than
delivering passengers. However, if you want to use it to deliver passengers,
well, it can deliver passengers. Enjoy.
One-Person Long-Range Sightseer (approval required) (any Hermes branch)
H-07B HERMES COMMUNICATIONS TWO PASSENGER LUXURY LONG-RANGE SIGHTSEER
Class: Shuttle
Model number: H-07b                     Designation: Long-Range Sightseer
Turret hardpoints: 2                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 2500         Standard battery hours: 20
Docking bay size required: 5
This ship has a living quarters, and can be attached to a tactical platform. It
is a passenger ship like the above-listed ship, so you can use it to deliver
passengers if you really want to. However, with its twenty-hour battery life it
would probably be more suited for the bonuses it has to offer the tactical
platform like the other sightseer.

[Tactical Communication] Ali Candan transmits, "Beacons?"

[Tactical Communication] Michael Kennedy transmits, "After this one sure."
help civilian
--
Star Conquest Help: Civilian Liaisons
--
Category: Game Systems
--
Civilian liaisons are pilots in your alliance, just like you, who have the added
ability to act as go-betweens between the pilot corps and your alliance
government. These serve for one term lasting six weeks, and then the positions
are up for nomination and voting once again.
The actual positions differ among the alliances, but they all have the same
basic four functions.
* Voice - The Voice has the power to speak directly with the alliance
government. He or she can also manage voting by the pilot corps.
* Space Defense - The person in charge of space defense is able to monitor the
alliance's sectors and send information directly to alliance ships.
* Ground Squad - The person in charge of ground-based combat can view
information about the alliance's ground readiness and monitor ground actions in
progress.
* Industrial Whip - The industrial whip is able to monitor the corps' progress
toward achieving its performance goals or winning Conquest.
Civilian Liaisons
AEU
* Voice of the Corps:                    Constantine Stone                      
  0010-16336
* Space Defense Captain:                 Shule Elemmire                         
  0010-89705
* Industrial Whip:                       Dakhal Araegin                         
  0010-99616
* Ground Squad Leader:                   Lily Kaise                             
  0010-23181
Fringe
* Space Defense Captain:                 Nina Thomas                            
  0100-25477
* Industrial Whip:                       Ted Warburton                          
  0100-15597
* Ground Squad Leader:                   Evenia Callseah                        
  0100-08779
League
* Voice of the League:                   Nissi Valdaire                         
  0001-66298
* Space Defense Captain:                 Emily Ford                             
  0001-99451
* Industrial Whip:                       Katina Faye                            
  0001-39168
* Ground Squad Leader:                   Melinda Michaels                       
  0001-96047
Mutuality
* Progress Observation Comrade:          Cheri Lindbergh                        
  0000-77875
* People's Defense Commissar:            Aisling                                
  0000-73097
In addition, there is a counterpart liaison within the alliance government. This
person is a government official who is in charge of issues relating to the
civilian pilot corps. Note that, as a regular civilian pilot, you should
generally not contact these people directly -- that is the job of your Voice.
But if there is a pressing need to go over the head of your Voice, or if, as
Voice, you wish to communicate privately for some reason, you may wish to write
a letter to your official government liaison directly.
Government Liaisons
AEU
* Andrew Lambeth
Fringe
* Space Commodore Tashiro Yuki
* Sector Captain Conrad Hart
League
* Tobermory Wellington
Mutuality
* Aleksei Frolov
* Cassandra of Turanova
* Other relevant station controllers
EAOS
* Professor Sonorous Griswold
Special Term Actions
Regular nominations and voting both occur automatically. However, there are
other actions that may occur during a term. These actions are not based in coded
mechanics, but rather must be roleplayed appropriately with your Voice or a
government liaison.
Non-binding resolutions: The most common special action. Non-binding
resolutions, or proposals, can be initiated by the Voice at any time using the
voting machine in your liaison office's conference room. All active pilots are
free to vote however they wish on this proposal. The Voice may then communicate
the results to the government. However, the government is not obligated to take
any action that it does not consider appropriate no matter how many pilots
support it; hence "non-binding."
Recall elections: A recall election occurs when an elected office-holder has
performed unsatisfactorily and a vote is held to determine whether to remove him
or her from office before the term has ended. Most properly, more than one pilot
should petition the Voice to initiate such a proposal before it occurs. After an
appropriate time, the proposal can be ended and the results should be
communicated to the government. If the pilots are in favor of a recall and the
government considers their reasoning valid, the office-holder in question will
be removed. Pilots may also initiate such an action against their Voice, if the
situation calls for it, by petitioning their liaison within the government.
Resignations: An office-holder may communicate to their government, either
through the Voice or directly, that they cannot complete their term and wish to
resign. Usually such a resignation will be accepted within a day or two, leaving
the position vacant. This action should not be taken lightly, and all players
should seek to complete their terms. It is a responsibility both ICly and OOCly.
Special election: A special election occurs when a position is vacant in the
middle of a term (for instance, after a resignation or a recall election) and
must be filled. The Voice should allow at least 24 hours to take nominations and
should then list all interested candidates in a single proposal. At the end of
the vote, the results must be communicated to the government and the position
will be filled. Note that this is the only valid way to fill a vacant position;
an office-holder cannot, for example, resign their position and name someone
else to fill it.
Negotiations: Voices are authorized to call meetings with representatives from
other pilot corps and negotiate for new treaties or other changes in relations.
A Voice should communicate openly with his or her government and their own pilot
corps throughout this process, and verify via voting that their actions have the
corps' approval at every step in the process. A final non-binding resolution
must occur to verify the final terms of the agreement. If the government
approves the agreement, official documents will be provided for all parties to
sign in a final meeting. Note that all treaties must be justified by good
roleplaying and must fit current plotlines; buddies in different alliances often
want to make their respective corps exchange technology and such, but unless
their alliances have a lengthy history of good relations, the governments are
unlikely to consider such an exchange. Behind the scenes, theme, current
plotlines, and game balance are all taken into consideration when players are
seeking new treaties.
Declaration of war: A corps may unilaterally declare war against another pilot
corps. While this does not usually pit the alliances themselves against each
other, it will greatly escalate tensions. There should be a good reason to
consider such an action, or the government will be questioning the Voice rather
strenuously. Otherwise, the usual rules about non-binding resolutions apply.
In all corps actions, all pilots should be invited to gather to discuss the new
proposal. Witnesses should also be invited when the Voice determines the results
of a proposal. The date and time of any important meeting should be communicated
to the government in case the government liaison wishes to attend.
Note, finally, that all office-holders are under particular scrutiny, both by
their government and the media, and unwise remarks or actions can result in
controversy.
The Current Term
A civilian liaison term lasts for six weeks.
The current civilian term started on 21 August 2317 GST. Time remaining: 15
days, 3 hours, 31 minutes, and 38 seconds
--

Subject: Re: Say no to Outccord
Author: Nissi Valdaire
Posted: 21:05 16 September 2317 GST
--
Lily:
The blame for this doesn't belong with Evenia or Johann or even really with the
person who asked us all to leave your org off stations after that incident
during the protest. That was just the final straw. Many had been kicking around
the idea of making others responsible for your stations for days before that.
And that is completely because you've made it as difficult as possible for
certain other people also involved in station building to work with you. If
you're going to blame something, blame that.
You know I have always trusted you on my expedition crews and so on, that I've
never had any serious issue with you or been much for the bashing of you that
goes on sometimes. So I hope you can trust me when I say that given what needs
to happen with stations on a regular basis, this will just work out better for
everyone. I'm sure things can return to normal once you show you can set aside
differences to work with people professionally, but your posts here aren't the
way to do that. Until then this is the best way to keep stationbuilding going
smoothly. That's it. There's no conspiracy against you.
Nissi
--

power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Deadly Strike, you are given undock
clearance under the AEU-EAOS non-aggression pact."
The computer reports that the two-person medium transport "Registered Merchant
384" has docked with The Torus (Dock Alpha).
ftl new
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
Via general sector communication, AEU Battery-Powered Message Beacon transmits,
"There is nothing that will change the crushing reality that Outccord is a
failure! STOP Outccord right now!"
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."

read paper
--
Johann,
Thanks so much for being so gracious as to allow us to come. You know i'm not
into starting up heated disagreements with a bunch of other pilots around and in
a confined space. In fact, I've called Morris down on his behavior as he and
Aisling kept going at one another on one trip to the point where it just
disrupted everything. Nobody could get a word in with others and it created
horrible negativity. On this last trip, he and Sarah finally had their final
falling out and oh my gods that was too much drama. This was destined to happen
but it's always Morris and something to do with him.
As for Evenia, well it takes two you know. I didn't know what was even going on
for two days until I went to check mail and as I was posting a letter, I suppose
ather handed me a letter then I noticed it a little later as I wasn't looking
up. I wrote yu both asking what was going on with the salvage Station, no
response and then I was told by Constantine how she had removed modules from our
warehouse without even a word. I can forgive and forget when people treat me and
those who work with me fairly. People had told me that evenia can be your friend
to the extent that it serves her. I honestly didn't believe them because there
are so many really evil pilots out there and I felt they were merely spreading
dirt and because they get away with it. I'd like to still hold Evenia in a
higher regard than others do but what she did came across as betrayal when I
thought out of all other pilots, that LIBS would stick with us and not give into
Ather who, as you know is extremely bittered. I sympathize with ather's
situation as what he did was not at all deserving of being rogued nor Eli.
Still, i will do my utmost to get along with evenia on this trip but it will
take me awhile to sort this out as I was deeply hurt by her actions.
As for your approach towards me when I might have been late with putting up a
station, I will accept your word. I just felt put off because I already felt
badly that I hadn't been able to put a station back together. Now that I have
Constantine on board with building, he is a tremendous help and I know he was
pleased to continue to help out with 777. Shule does also but he's just not much
into building. He will go deploy stations but I have to do the assembly work
ahead of time.
I'm sorry Johann for what I've said. I considered you to be a friend before but
I felt that you turned your back on me for Ather's hate on Lily action. He found
a means to exploit something and he got away with it for all of the wrong
reasons.
As for the starship we'd like to bring, It may just be Shule and myself because
Constantine is concerned about being away from his post too long. I respect his
decision but he already has expressed a keen interest in Exploration and i so
wanted him to be a part of this. I wanted our members to be able to launch and
go artifacting if I wasn't available. But as long as i'm in the Sightseer,
anyone can launch as it's a Long-Range. We have other smaller ships but they
don't have Hyperwave and we can't go across the Skim to get upgrades so we
couldn't get them upgraded. I haven't seen Tara around a lot over the past
couple of days. I posted a Comm notice for everyone to be aware of and so
hopefully, it will be that we can bring her along with us. So my answer is yes,
a Sightseer and if Tara joins us, if there is room for her Scout or a Runabout
for her, then fine. Otherwise, Shule and I will take her artifacting in the
Sightseer as we don't want to prevent others from going who want to go as well.
As for maintaining 777, please reconsiderworking with us again. I know Nissi
mentioned problems with stations but the only station I was involved with out in
the other areas was the Asteroid station in 285 and it's been all Morris.
Melinda wrote me a letter and explicitly told me that he wasn't to be added to
the Asteroid processor so here I get caught in the middle because Morris is
pressuring me and so my response to him was that if Joel didn't provide a module
or we could figure out a Module that he could obtain, then I would certainly
accomodate him but as per usual, this wasn't enough for Morris so I'm sure he
put up a big fuss with Nissi and got his way. I really didn't care one way or
the other but when he was pressuring me, I had to tell him what i was asked to
do and I still accomodated him. So this is no reason for us to be taken off of
stations. If I had room for Morris, I'd accomodate him even though I am truly
not over-fond of him. I consider this to be a business arrangement and liking
someone isn't what always makes business evolve.
Johann, we'll be ready on the 22nd. If there's anything we can do, please don't
hesitate to call on any of SEAS to help.
Lily
--
read letter
--
Lily. I don't have a problem with Seas coming along at all. I can't speak for
everyone, but I hope that everyone going can at least be curteous while confined
in a small area. Hopefully us all being in the same place will help everyone
settle things down, although I do know that Evenia is still quite upset by some
of your accusations, and an effort to positively communicate would go a long way
towards mitigating that.
I appreciate your offer to provide stations, but we are actually already stocked
up on stuff and the stuff we need is the stuff I need to get from cats. Since
the only station that's providing money is the repair station, and probably only
a few hundred thousand credits at most, no org will be missing out on much if
any.
As a side note, I am sorry you took my tone about stations going down as me
being upset. Generally when I ask about stations it's generally just me making
sure people are aware it's down or almost down, and if they're not able to put
it up what I need to do to help out. The only times I can picture being abrupt
is if there's a pilot trapped somewhere, but that's more I want them to get home
safely as soon as they can.
Also, clarification, if the four of you are going, you're bringing the scout? Or
are you bringing the siteseer regardless?
thanks,
Johann Schraft
--
read paper
--
Johann,
Thanks so much for being so gracious as to allow us to come. You know i'm not
into starting up heated disagreements with a bunch of other pilots around and in
a confined space. In fact, I've called Morris down on his behavior as he and
Aisling kept going at one another on one trip to the point where it just
disrupted everything. Nobody could get a word in with others and it created
horrible negativity. On this last trip, he and Sarah finally had their final
falling out and oh my gods that was too much drama. This was destined to happen
but it's always Morris and something to do with him.
As for Evenia, well it takes two you know. I didn't know what was even going on
for two days until I went to check mail and as I was posting a letter, I suppose
ather handed me a letter then I noticed it a little later as I wasn't looking
up. I wrote yu both asking what was going on with the salvage Station, no
response and then I was told by Constantine how she had removed modules from our
warehouse without even a word. I can forgive and forget when people treat me and
those who work with me fairly. People had told me that evenia can be your friend
to the extent that it serves her. I honestly didn't believe them because there
are so many really evil pilots out there and I felt they were merely spreading
dirt and because they get away with it. I'd like to still hold Evenia in a
higher regard than others do but what she did came across as betrayal when I
thought out of all other pilots, that LIBS would stick with us and not give into
Ather who, as you know is extremely bittered. I sympathize with ather's
situation as what he did was not at all deserving of being rogued nor Eli.
Still, i will do my utmost to get along with evenia on this trip but it will
take me awhile to sort this out as I was deeply hurt by her actions.
As for your approach towards me when I might have been late with putting up a
station, I will accept your word. I just felt put off because I already felt
badly that I hadn't been able to put a station back together. Now that I have
Constantine on board with building, he is a tremendous help and I know he was
pleased to continue to help out with 777. Shule does also but he's just not much
into building. He will go deploy stations but I have to do the assembly work
ahead of time.
I'm sorry Johann for what I've said. I considered you to be a friend before but
I felt that you turned your back on me for Ather's hate on Lily action. He found
a means to exploit something and he got away with it for all of the wrong
reasons.
As for the starship we'd like to bring, It may just be Shule and myself because
Constantine is concerned about being away from his post too long. I respect his
decision but he already has expressed a keen interest in Exploration and i so
wanted him to be a part of this. I wanted our members to be able to launch and
go artifacting if I wasn't available. But as long as i'm in the Sightseer,
anyone can launch as it's a Long-Range. We have other smaller ships but they
don't have Hyperwave and we can't go across the Skim to get upgrades so we
couldn't get them upgraded. I haven't seen Tara around a lot over the past
couple of days. I posted a Comm notice for everyone to be aware of and so
hopefully, it will be that we can bring her along with us. So my answer is yes,
a Sightseer and if Tara joins us, if there is room for her Scout or a Runabout
for her, then fine. Otherwise, Shule and I will take her artifacting in the
Sightseer as we don't want to prevent others from going who want to go as well.
As for maintaining 777, please reconsiderworking with us again. I know Nissi
mentioned problems with stations but the only station I was involved with out in
the other areas was the Asteroid station in 285 and it's been all Morris.
Melinda wrote me a letter and explicitly told me that he wasn't to be added to
the Asteroid processor so here I get caught in the middle because Morris is
pressuring me and so my response to him was that if Joel didn't provide a module
or we could figure out a Module that he could obtain, then I would certainly
accomodate him but as per usual, this wasn't enough for Morris so I'm sure he
put up a big fuss with Nissi and got his way. I really didn't care one way or
the other but when he was pressuring me, I had to tell him what i was asked to
do and I still accomodated him. So this is no reason for us to be taken off of
stations. If I had room for Morris, I'd accomodate him even though I am truly
not over-fond of him. I consider this to be a business arrangement and liking
someone isn't what always makes business evolve.
Johann, we'll be ready on the 22nd. If there's anything we can do, please don't
hesitate to call on any of SEAS to help.
Lily

Subject: eath and Avarice is calling all pilots
Author: Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident
Posted: 22:56 16 September 2317 GST
--
Death and Avarice is calling all pilots is an Artifacting trip to a field of
shipwrecks very far out there near Feng Wo Station in the Feng Wo Trading
Collective. We may even get our hands on those rare remote Artifacts. I only
have perhaps one of those rare Remote Artifacts out of the hundreds of artifacts
that I have collected. So this is so exciting and it is an uncommon opportunity
albeit since artifacts out over 30 Light-Trade Cycles don't even yield much for
those of us with higher Exploration experience anymore.
Let's coordinate so that any of you who want to go are with Shule and me prior
to leaving and so on.
Here are the Departure Details from Johann:
We will be departing on Friday, September 22, at 23:59. Please respond if you
are going at least twelve hours before departure so we can organize who's going
in the carrier and who is going with me in the transport.
The Carrier can accomodate 120 Units of docked starships. If a lot of scouts are
docked, it means fewer people can go so take this into consideration. I am
taking a Sightseer which only requires 5 Units of Docking Bay space whereas a
Scout requires 12.5 Units. Our AEU Scouts are a bit smaller than League because
of the League's larger Cargo Hold. Constantine or Tara, if you both want to go
and bring your own ships, remember that Hyperwave communications is essential
out there particularly with situations whereby the Sector where the stations are
becomes hot with Pirates, Ifs and let's hope no Outsiders. You certainly don't
want to be on your way in if the Sector is hot and end up in an escape Pod. A
Runabout requires 6.5 Docking Bay Units so that's not a bad choice provided you
have a Autovector Drive as you won't needa Rift Drive either. Shule and I are
fine to accomodate you both in the Sightseer. It will be a bit cozy in there
with 4 of us but we will make it work! It's just that I have to be on board to
launch it which I certainly can be most of the time. So it just depends on your
own preference. If Johann can accomodate you, then bring whatever ship you
prefer but nothing larger than an exploration Scout and you need to clear this
with Johann Schraft prior to arrival to dock your starship.
This trip's duration is about three weeks of time as it will require a few days
to travel out to this Field. I would think we will likely go to Andy's and
perhaps onto tom Town and although it wasn't mentioned, perhaps to Feng Wo
Station.
If you can join us, this is truly going to be one of those memorable trips and
it will definitely be worth your time to participate.
Lily Kaise
--

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
The two-person flare "Deadly Strike" is landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine, a small trash can, and a sanitation drone
here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.

read paper
--
Johann, I will apologize to evenia but she isn't being as forthcoming as you'd
like. I know for a fact, that she made advances toward Shule and it made Shule
extremely uncomfortable as we are and have been an intact couple for over a year
and a half now. We'd be married now if the aEU Government would allow AEU pilots
to marry. It's like this Johann, we all meet others throughout our lives and
careers who we are attracted to. It's how you approach thos attractions or how
you choose to remain silent for personal or for professional reasons. You don't
express such to another person who is in an intact relationship as it's an
obvious ploy to cause interference. I knew this and thankfully, so far as i
know, Shule has been faithful and I was willing to let this go since he is the
one who sleeps with me. So based upon some other information i have which has
certainly been expressed by other pilots, again, I was not in agreement with
them as I thought perhaps Evenia was mis-understood, and yes, even knowing what
I know relative to my own personal relationship with someone. So I didn't refer
to her behavior specifically as being promiscuous but it certainly isn't
appropriate behavior. Then when she didn't even inform me of her intentions and
took the modules out of our warehouse, this sounded lots of alarms. It also
created an atmosphere of a serious breech of trust. As for Morris, I didn't
realize what he had done until Constantine informed me of Evenia's actions and
so I took a look at the log and of course Morris was having a party out there
obviously! I unfortunately will probably never trust Evenia to the extent that I
did so she must agree to at least one condition before I apologize to her. That
condition is that ifever she is to remove more than certain Modules from SEAS
Warehouse, that we discuss it first. Yes those Modules belonged to LIBS.
However, in turn, she tied our hands to the point whereby we have already lost
the Transmitter in 777 which I was going to put together that day as I certainly
wanted LIBS to be included in spite of not making a single credit on anything
but the Toll Station Still, I am willing to apologize to her but she must agree
to be more forthcoming about things in the future. I would not allow anyone from
SEAS nor do that to LIBS without your having some knowledge about what was to
take place and the reasons why. I really don't think this is too much to ask as
it's merely asking for common courtessy towards the party to whom you may no
longer to do business with. They should at least have an understanding as to the
circumstances of the breech of contract or other business arrangements. If a
Trustee of mine did this, I would demote them. I don't dictate to my members but
I hold them to a high ethical standard and so far, I believe in all of them. If
I could divide up SEAS into shares, each would have equal ownership because I
look to them as having their own Organization which I was able to provide
startup costs and other aspects for but it's theirs as much as it is mine. So
this is another reason why I take this personally as although others wanted to
inflict harm upon me, they didn't stop to consider that there are three others
besides me. Therefore, if they have an issue with me, then they should address
it with me and not SEAS. I am personally disappointed that I couldn't
participate in the protest as I would have but personal circumstances kept me
away for which I don't believe I owe an apology for except that I regret that I
couldn't be available. This sort of harsh treatment was not warranted as I have
done far more than the majority of AEU pilots to oppose Outccort and I won't
stop for as long as I am able to. Our Liaison office is so not responding to us
too which gives me the impression that we have made progress. I'll probably put
up some more signs before I escape out of Comms too and if they catch me, then
good luck to them! So yes, Evenia isn't perfect, nor are all of us but she needs
to communicate her intentions especially when they are as drastic as what
occurred the other day. If I receive your acknowledgement of this, I will
restore yours and Evenia's access to SEAS Warehouse. I never revoked Nicolette's
because, ironically, she has been one of the few pilots who have been reasonable
and fair when we worked together on the Asteroid station in 288 and otherwise.
we've also had our differences. However, I've seen a lot of very positive growth
in Nicolette and so you see, I am always willing to forgive others when they
make an honest and concerted effort to correct their behavior. I am sorry that
Nicolette's own organization didn't go forward. However, I find some humor in
what she was doing and perhaps this is what her intention was all along! As
oftentimes, I would love to express something very similar and especially to the
Morris's in the Universe! Take Care, Lily
--

read letter
--
Lily. I don't have a problem with Seas coming along at all. I can't speak for
everyone, but I hope that everyone going can at least be curteous while confined
in a small area. Hopefully us all being in the same place will help everyone
settle things down, although I do know that Evenia is still quite upset by some
of your accusations, and an effort to positively communicate would go a long way
towards mitigating that.
I appreciate your offer to provide stations, but we are actually already stocked
up on stuff and the stuff we need is the stuff I need to get from cats. Since
the only station that's providing money is the repair station, and probably only
a few hundred thousand credits at most, no org will be missing out on much if
any.
As a side note, I am sorry you took my tone about stations going down as me
being upset. Generally when I ask about stations it's generally just me making
sure people are aware it's down or almost down, and if they're not able to put
it up what I need to do to help out. The only times I can picture being abrupt
is if there's a pilot trapped somewhere, but that's more I want them to get home
safely as soon as they can.
Also, clarification, if the four of you are going, you're bringing the scout? Or
are you bringing the siteseer regardless?
thanks,
Johann Schraft
--

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a dusky pink rattan cabinet, a small red ball containing a realistic
Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy pale purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a large oval
dark purple and light purple cloth rug, a white four poster rattan bed with a
heart-shaped headboard and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle
cashmere blanket, a set of lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow,
a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow
on it, a small purple trash bin, and a small oval turquoise rattan table with a
glass top here.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident is dozing on a white four poster rattan bed.
You can go out.
(You are lying on a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard
and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a set of
lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow, a hand-made purple and
amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it.)
who
There appear to be about 6 pilots recently active.
The communicator network detects:

Katina Faye  (L)
Melinda Michaels  (L)
Morris Corlew  (L)
Ali Candan  (L)
Your communicator also reports that there is 1 pilot who was active but dropped
out of communications.
Additionally, there are 10 pilots who appear to have their communicators on but
have not recently been active.
Final total: 16 pilots.

[AEU | 1: Alliance Communication] Jacob Shields transmits, "I honestly don't
like being on strike any more than the next pilot. I feel like I have to do
something to stop from falling asleep."
[AEU | 1: Alliance Communication] Patriot Constantine Stone transmits, "I'm
doing okay, Jacob. I get what you mean. Sometimes I feel like I can not be a
pilot from Velouria."
[AEU | 1: Alliance Communication] Patriot Constantine Stone transmits, "There's
no reason to do it in this dingy office."
[AEU | 1: Alliance Communication] Rogue Ace Pilot Ather Jammoa transmits, "Well,
I know that I am. The rest of you, I know that you're trying to shoot high, and
you're pretty fresh out of pilot training. I understand that your priorities are
different. The administration is probably counting on that though, and waiting
for you guys to just say fuck it and start working. Which we can't stop you from
doing, but I'm doing what I can by cautioning you."
[Space Explorers Amidst The Stars] Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident transmits,
"Ather is correct up to a point Constantine but you should do what you want to.
We never have to turn in those artifacts at all either! We could also turn them
in on other alliance ports and aEU really wouldn't benefit."

i
 You are wearing nothing. You are also wearing a keychain, a solid silver ring
engraved with dolphins, and a gold wrist-mounted chronometer. You are concealing
a metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator, a flight control scanner, a
large expandable telescoping xenology container, a scorched metal thigh holster,
a golden Feng Wo coin purse, a camera bag, a black engineering tool case, a
black flightbag with a red shooting star on the side, a leather briefcase, a
backpack, and a metallic gold touch einrophone. Your head, face, both eyes,
neck, both shoulders, chest, back, both biceps, both elbows, abdomen, both
forearms, both wrists, both hands, waist, both hips, groin, both thighs, both
knees, both calves, both ankles, and both feet are left uncovered.
You are carrying a sheet of white paper in your right hand, and a small suitcase
in your left hand.
l paper
a sheet of white paper
This thin sheet of slightly nubby white paper is of standard stationery size.
This is a letter. It is not addressed. You recognise the handwriting as
belonging to Lily Kaise.
read paper
--
Johann, I will apologize to evenia but she isn't being as forthcoming as you'd
like. I know for a fact, that she made advances toward Shule and it made Shule
extremely uncomfortable as we are and have been an intact couple for over a year
and a half now. We'd be married now if the aEU Government would allow AEU pilots
to marry. It's like this Johann, we all meet others throughout our lives and
careers who we are attracted to. It's how you approach thos attractions or how
you choose to remain silent for personal or for professional reasons. You don't
express such to another person who is in an intact relationship as it's an
obvious ploy to cause interference. I knew this and thankfully, so far as i
know, Shule has been faithful and I was willing to let this go since he is the
one who sleeps with me. So based upon some other information i have which has
certainly been expressed by other pilots, again, I was not in agreement with
them as I thought perhaps Evenia was mis-understood, and yes, even knowing what
I know relative to my own personal relationship with someone. So I didn't refer
to her behavior specifically as being promiscuous but it certainly isn't
appropriate behavior. Then when she didn't even inform me of her intentions and
took the modules out of our warehouse, this sounded lots of alarms. It also
created an atmosphere of a serious breech of trust. As for Morris, I didn't
realize what he had done until Constantine informed me of Evenia's actions and
so I took a look at the log and of course Morris was having a party out there
obviously! I unfortunately will probably never trust Evenia to the extent that I
did so she must agree to at least one condition before I apologize to her. That
condition is that ifever she is to remove more than certain Modules from SEAS
Warehouse, that we discuss it first. Yes those Modules belonged to LIBS.
However, in turn, she tied our hands to the point whereby we have already lost
the Transmitter in 777 which I was going to put together that day as I certainly
wanted LIBS to be included in spite of not making a single credit on anything
but the Toll Station Still, I am willing to apologize to her but she must agree
to be more forthcoming about things in the future. I would not allow anyone from
SEAS nor do that to LIBS without your having some knowledge about what was to
take place and the reasons why. I really don't think this is too much to ask as
it's merely asking for common courtessy towards the party to whom you may no
longer to do business with. They should at least have an understanding as to the
circumstances of the breech of contract or other business arrangements. If a
Trustee of mine did this, I would demote them. I don't dictate to my members but
I hold them to a high ethical standard and so far, I believe in all of them. If
I could divide up SEAS into shares, each would have equal ownership because I
look to them as having their own Organization which I was able to provide
startup costs and other aspects for but it's theirs as much as it is mine. So
this is another reason why I take this personally as although others wanted to
inflict harm upon me, they didn't stop to consider that there are three others
besides me. Therefore, if they have an issue with me, then they should address
it with me and not SEAS. I am personally disappointed that I couldn't
participate in the protest as I would have but personal circumstances kept me
away for which I don't believe I owe an apology for except that I regret that I
couldn't be available. This sort of harsh treatment was not warranted as I have
done far more than the majority of AEU pilots to oppose Outccort and I won't
stop for as long as I am able to. Our Liaison office is so not responding to us
too which gives me the impression that we have made progress. I'll probably put
up some more signs before I escape out of Comms too and if they catch me, then
good luck to them! So yes, Evenia isn't perfect, nor are all of us but she needs
to communicate her intentions especially when they are as drastic as what
occurred the other day. If I receive your acknowledgement of this, I will
restore yours and Evenia's access to SEAS Warehouse. I never revoked Nicolette's
because, ironically, she has been one of the few pilots who have been reasonable
and fair when we worked together on the Asteroid station in 288 and otherwise.
we've also had our differences. However, I've seen a lot of very positive growth
in Nicolette and so you see, I am always willing to forgive others when they
make an honest and concerted effort to correct their behavior. I am sorry that
Nicolette's own organization didn't go forward. However, I find some humor in
what she was doing and perhaps this is what her intention was all along! As
oftentimes, I would love to express something very similar and especially to the
Morris's in the Universe! Take Care, Lily
--

Starships In Sector:
Registered Merchant 988.................(8, 11, 14)
What was once a feature of interstellar geography is now the name of an
alliance, and the heart of Fringe space can be found past this gateway. The tiny
station of Nuevo Laredo stands guard here.
The planet of Chetumal floats before you here, the richest planet among the
Fringe Worlds, although that isn't saying a lot.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Chetumal in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation order
is entered."

Welcome to Chetumal Orbit!"

FTL Interalliance Communications Network
