Subject: Letter to Nissi Valdaire in Defense of SEAS
Author: Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident
Posted: 23:00 17 September 2317 GST
--
Hi nissi,
Up until 'know-it-all' Morris formed his own organization, I did fairly well
with station building. I was only maintaining the Asteroid Station in 285 but
Morris kept clamoring for it which I mentioned to Melinda as I really was ready
to let him take it over. Melinda kept saying that he shouldn't always get his
way and not to cave- into him. However, Morris has been excessively jealous of
SEAS since its inception and done everything possible to prevent our growth. So
when Morris left starseekers and when he established his organization, Melinda
wrote to me as follows:
hi,
Morris is not yet in a position to earn anything from stations. However, as I
have done for every org, including Seas, when he is able to begin earning
megacredits, he gets preferencial treatment. He is planning to vassalize so
we'll want him to get megacredits quickly. Joel even got this done for him when
he was starting out.
Melinda
Therefore, when I was ready to build the next Asteroid Processor in 285, Morris
started pressuring me to include him. I wrote him and informed him that Melinda
had specifically specified that he not be included just yet. However, if I had a
slot, that I would be more than happy to accomodate him which I did from day
one. I know he likely pitched a fit with you Nissi. Still, please understand
that I was following Melinda's directive and had to be straight with him. I did
accomodate him and never left him nor anyone off of the processor who I could
obtain Modules from. Joel has been very difficult to deal with because he
wouldn't provide modules so I had to hunt for them. So recently, he finally
loaded a couple of Cores into SEAS Warehouse and then ather had his Tantrum. So
I know that you want to hear everyone but I honestly believe that SEAS nor I
have been given a fair deal here. Morris, as you know makes a lot of clamor
about everything. I realize that you should listen to your own Alliance pilots
first. Other than this, I certainly would appreciate knowing what the other
issues were as I have worked diligently to maintain the Asteroid Processor in
285 and to be certain that there was little downtime. I've had my Trustees
available to deploy the Asteroid Processor whenever I couldn't.
I have worked very hard, per the available time that I am at work on the effort
to obstruct and to campaign against Outccord, far more than the majority of AEU
pilots. So it's unfortunate that the time which Eli planned the protest effort,
I simply could not come to work. When I had already started out to put up the
Beacon, I had no knowledge, whatsoever, that the protest was ongoing as Eli
didn't post anything to other aEU pilots. I frequently mute the General channel
too so if he announced it there, then he left out the rest of us but still, i
wasn't at work so I wouldn't have heard anything and known. Had I done nothing
up to that point to work towards Outccord, I would consider what Ather claimed
to be justified but it's clear he did this for spite without any consideration
for what I have already accomplished towards this end.
Thank you Nissi
Kind regards,
Lily Kaise
--

FTL Interalliance Communications Network

Subject: Re: Death and Avarice is calling all pilots. Preliminary post
Author: Melinda Michaels
Posted: 00:29 18 September 2317 GST
--
Given the latest news headline I am going to have to decline this artifacting
trip for the time being. This is the second headline about violence in a few
days. While I am fully aware that these issues will have to primarily be dealt
with by the AEU, something may come up that would require others assistance. I
apologize for any inconvenience this causes anyone but feel it's the right
decision for me at this time. For those who go, enjoy and have a prosperous
trip. I just feel that the waters are growing more turbulent here at home and
cannot, in good conscience, make the trip.
Melinda
--

Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident says, "That sounds insensitive and I sure don't
mean it that way."
squeeze lily 'You're fine.
Cheri-Pye the large light violet felo hums melodically to itself as it wanders
south.
I don't see that here.
squeeze lily 'You're fine.
I don't see that here.
squeeze lily
You squeeze Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident affectionately.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident says, "I'll reserve o my decision as there are
some days which will elapse prior to the 22nd but if it seems we'll need to
decline, of course we will."
nod lily 
You nod to Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident says, "Melinda, as per usual just doesn't want us
participating and so she bases her opinons on her personal agenda."
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident says, "Opinions."
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident says, "We will, however certainly do the
responsible thing."
nod and grin 
You nod and grin.
[General Communication] James Donovan transmits, "Is the watchtower in 285
powered by debris?"
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "No."
[General Communication] Erik Goodwin transmits, "That would be very awkward."
[General Communication] James Donovan transmits, "It has about 3 days of battery
power remaining."
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "Right now, pretty ^u^h only
reason to go out there is for {"ids."
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "I know."
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident says, "So they really have fucked up 777. Someone
built one of the stations with a Fission Reactor and that won't last very long."
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident laughs.
'Wow!
You exclaim, "Wow!"
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident says, "Look at the temp station list then they
used Fringe cores."
nod
You nod.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident says, "Oh Evenia the genious station builder."
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident says, "Seriously, she tries but she needs a lot of
hand-holding."
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident says, "Whenever I had her put up the Asteroid
Processor, I had to have it already set up on lifters for her in a separate
ship."
nod
You nod.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident says, "Those Fission Breeder Reacters are powerful
but their life is short and so it's not a good idea to use them unless you need
that much power."
A long gold soft-bodied creature with many claw-tipped tentacles propels itself
through the tank, stirring up tiny particles.
'YEah, she should know that.
You say, "YEah, she should know that."
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident says, "They cost ten megacredits versus a Large
Precharged Battery which costs 8 and typically lasts longer if you don't exceed
the power requirement."
nod
You nod.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident says, "Ok going to New Earth for a few."
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident grasps a large lever on the control board and
pushes it slowly away from her.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
Lily says to you, "Are you ok to go along?"
A large semi-transparent spherical creature with long dangling tendrils and a
green glowing interior drifts slowly past a small plastic statue of a shark.
grin 'ok
You grin. "Ok."
smile
You smile.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident uses the ship's radio to ask flight control for
launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "William Dove, you are given undock
clearance under the AEU-EAOS non-aggression pact."
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident squeezes you affectionately.
[General Communication] Melinda Michaels transmits, "Ather, we pilots of the
League made your pilots decision for them. So now they can pretend they did it."
squeeze lily
You squeeze Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident affectionately.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident presses a button and brings up the FTL flight
control board.
[General Communication] Rogue Ace Pilot Ather Jammoa chortles.
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
Via general sector communication, AEU Battery-Powered Message Beacon transmits,
"There is nothing that will change the crushing reality that Outccord is a
failure! STOP Outccord right now!"
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
[General Communication] Morris Corlew laughs.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."
Via general sector communication, AEU Battery-Powered Message Beacon transmits,
"Supporting Outccord equals supporting the extinction of all of humanity. Make
your choice carefully!"
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, William
Dove! Welcome to home space!"
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "League t) the rescu-."
[General Communication] Rogue Ace Pilot Ather Jammoa transmits, "Lily will
probably more than likely end up complaining more about the artifacting trip
getting canceled, instead if you all are going to do all that."
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident says, "No shit now you're admitting it Melinda."
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident says, "Heh I haven't complained about anything."
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident laughs.
[General Communication] Erik Goodwin transmits, "It'll be pretty sad if we all
drop out and seas are the only people to go."
laugh
You laugh.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident says, "I'm about to post to the org even."
The ship's computer automatically requests landing clearance.
[General Communication] Rogue Ace Pilot Ather Jammoa transmits, "While I like
Shule and Constantine, we'd be better off if Lily went, probably."
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Hello, William Dove. We read your AEU
transponder. You are cleared to land at the city of New Phoenix."
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident pulls a large lever towards her.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.
The computer sounds a notification indicating that the ship has been fully
charged.
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "They can't erik."

post in General/Exploration.

Subject: Death and Avarice postponed
Author: Johann Schraft
Posted: 00:46 18 September 2317 GST
--
Due to the AEU situation, lots of people are dropping out just in case.
rather than going with a limited crew, the trip will be postponed until the
situation is stable.
Everyone who has spots on the trip will have them reserved, should you wish to
go at that time.
thanks,
Johann Schraft
--

read paper
--
Hellow SEAS, based upon the most recent News reports as of 9-18-2317, we will be
observing developments over the next few days. Contrary to the nay-sayers of
Melinda Michaels and others, I certainly will not go forward to participate in
the upcoming Artifacting trip particularly we may need to be available to defend
our fellow citizens. So please be vigilent and of course there will be other
Exploration and Artifacting trips in the future.
To add to this, Johann has postponed the trip and this comes as a great relief
as I wouldn't want for you all to have prepared to go and then have to change
plans at the last minute. As you can see, there are some really childish pilots
out there and I don't think I need to name other names! There will certainly be
more trips in the future and i'm not as uncaring about our citizens as some
would like to fabricate based soley upon Ather's recent tantrum.
So stay tuned to your News Reader, the Message Boards and any other resources.
Above all, be ready to defend our aEU citizens and all other humanity.
Lily Kaise
--

ftl chetumal
What was once a feature of interstellar geography is now the name of an
alliance, and the heart of Fringe space can be found past this gateway. The tiny
station of Nuevo Laredo stands guard here.
The planet of Chetumal floats before you here, the richest planet among the
Fringe Worlds, although that isn't saying a lot.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Chetumal in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation order
is entered."

ftl new
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
Via general sector communication, AEU Battery-Powered Message Beacon transmits,
"There is nothing that will change the crushing reality that Outccord is a
failure! STOP Outccord right now!"
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."
Via general sector communication, AEU Battery-Powered Message Beacon transmits,
"Supporting Outccord equals supporting the extinction of all of humanity. Make
your choice carefully!"
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Deadly
Strike! Welcome to home space!"

read letter
--
Lily. I don't have a problem with Seas coming along at all. I can't speak for
everyone, but I hope that everyone going can at least be curteous while confined
in a small area. Hopefully us all being in the same place will help everyone
settle things down, although I do know that Evenia is still quite upset by some
of your accusations, and an effort to positively communicate would go a long way
towards mitigating that.
I appreciate your offer to provide stations, but we are actually already stocked
up on stuff and the stuff we need is the stuff I need to get from cats. Since
the only station that's providing money is the repair station, and probably only
a few hundred thousand credits at most, no org will be missing out on much if
any.
As a side note, I am sorry you took my tone about stations going down as me
being upset. Generally when I ask about stations it's generally just me making
sure people are aware it's down or almost down, and if they're not able to put
it up what I need to do to help out. The only times I can picture being abrupt
is if there's a pilot trapped somewhere, but that's more I want them to get home
safely as soon as they can.
Also, clarification, if the four of you are going, you're bringing the scout? Or
are you bringing the siteseer regardless?
thanks,
Johann Schraft
--

launch

from the various starship systems.
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Fearless, you are given undock
clearance under the AEU-EAOS non-aggression pact."
deploy
An EAOS Conjurer is brought forward from a small recess in the aft of the ship.
ftl new
Your ship 'Deadly Strike' has been automatically moved into a garage.
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
Via general sector communication, AEU Battery-Powered Message Beacon transmits,
"There is nothing that will change the crushing reality that Outccord is a
failure! STOP Outccord right now!"
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."
move
AutoStar detects 4 possible destinations.  Assembling destination list.  Please
wait.
1

Enter your destination:
A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: New Earth.
Via general sector communication, AEU Battery-Powered Message Beacon transmits,
"Supporting Outccord equals supporting the extinction of all of humanity. Make
your choice carefully!"
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Fearless!
Welcome to home space!"
enter
You press a button on an EAOS Conjurer, which splits open down the front. You
carefully climb inside.
The ship's computer automatically requests landing clearance.
status
I don't understand that.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Hello, Fearless. We read your AEU
transponder. You are cleared to land at the city of New Phoenix."

WEAPONS

   Module:     Laser

   Ammunition: Unlimited         Time To Fire: 8 seconds

ABILITIES
--
ARC
   Damages a single target.
   Module:     Plasma
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
PLASMA HAMMER
   Damages a single target with heavy, slow burst damage.
   Module:     Plasma
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 12 seconds
WAVE
   Damages a group of targets.
   Module:     Plasma
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 6 seconds
ERODE
   Covers a group of enemies with corroding plasma, reducing their armor.
   Module:     Plasma
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 8 seconds
ENVELOP
   Surrounds a target with plasma.
   Module:     Plasma
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 4 seconds
CASCADE
   Damages a group of targets.
   Module:     Plasma
   Energy:     70                Time To Use: 10 seconds
SPIKE
   A swift attack against a single target.
   Module:     Plasma
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 3 seconds
BOLT
   Heavily damages a single target.
   Module:     Plasma
   Energy:     50                Time To Use: 6 seconds
BURST
   Heavily damages a group of targets.
   Module:     Plasma
   Energy:     100               Time To Use: 6 seconds
PULSE
   Stuns a single target.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
SCRAMBLE
   Increases the likelihood that an enemy will drop intact items.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
REVERB
   Damages a single target over time.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 6 seconds
SONIC SLAM
   Interrupts a group of enemies with a large sonic burst.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 8 seconds
SONIC WAVE
   Decreases the accuracy of a group of enemies.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     25                Time To Use: 10 seconds
SHAKE OFF
   Makes an enemy slightly more disinclined to hit you.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 4 seconds
GROUP PULSE
   Stuns a group of targets.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 8 seconds
Current Energy: 495/495

ftl hyperion
A single star shines brightly in the dark here, the light strangely comforting.
The ship's sensors indicate that the star's spectrum is nearly identical to
Sol's.
Hyperion's famous Sea of Grass is immediately obvious upon gazing at the planet,
the rolling, meters-deep expanse of tall grasses obscuring the contours of the
surface.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Hyperion in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation order
is entered."
Via general sector communication, Hyperion transmits, "Hello there, Deadly
Strike! Welcome to home space!"

[Hyperion; ITPN Station; AEU Circuit]

l
[Hyperion; ITPN Station; AEU Circuit]
Newly built, with more creative flair than most ITPN stations, this charming
structure is finished in creamy stucco. Its floors are seamless with those of
the plaza to the south, gleaming cerulean blue tiles with grey flecks. Small
hand-carved stone fountains surround the raised passenger loading platform,
which is attended by a blue-suited and white-gloved ITPN attendant standing at
attention and studiously scanning passengers for their fares. Transport pods
regularly descend through the aperture in the ceiling, only to leave again a few
seconds later. Modern display panels are suspended from the ceiling, offering
arrival and departure times.
You can go south.
s
[Hyperion; Sea of Grass Spaceport]
You can go north, east, and south.
s

[Hyperion; Sea of Grass Spaceport]
Through the wide doors to the north you can see the landing pad and its busy
commotion. In contrast, the room around you stretches tranquil and cool,
utilizing shades of blue and grey to achieve the effect. A few travelers walk
slowly by, not seeming to be in much of a hurry.
You can go north, east, south, and west.

 TIP: Want to join a private organization run by fellow pilots? Find the
organization center in your capital spaceport!

[Starship "Deadly Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, a small hot beverage
dispenser, a small hot coffee dispenser, and an overstuffed dark green chair
here.
You can go east, southeast, and out.

Recent AEU Headlines

* President Best Calls on Pilots to Assist Troubled Worlds [18 September 2317]
(VET)
Return to the category menu? [Enter `yes' or `no']
n
You return your metallic gold touch einrophone to the main screen.
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.

Notice from the Ground Squad Leader: Greetings AEU, Regarding the new Ground
combat work available to us, although new work under different circumstances is
always challenging and fun! However, I highly discourage anyone to participate
in this work for the time-being. While I am in favor of helping to maintain
peace amongst citizens and to do whatever it takes to aid and to protect
humanity, I am very much not in favor of anyone's participation in work which
yields income to ourselves and to the Government towards this Peace-Keeping
initiative. If the Government has other options for us to do peace-keeping work
which involves no reward, then this will be acceptable. If you do engage, I will
not be over-concerned though with reports of destroyed battlesuits. I have a big
rubber stamp which will get some much-needed action! Hopefully it won't run dry
on ink! [20:35 18 September 2317 GST]

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
There appear to be some people in the lounge.
The five-person A.S.S. tactical platform "William Dove", the four-person light
carrier "You Have Clearance To Launch", and the two-person Accord gemini "Cherry
Cola Float" are landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine and a small trash can here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.

[New Earth; Trading Center]
The trading center seems to be one of the busiest places in the spaceport. Which
is not surprising, considering the profits that successful trading can bring in.
Avoiding the automated computer terminals used by the career traders, you decide
to approach a human trade clerk. This, incidentally, will also subject your
purchases and sales to less scrutiny.

[New Earth; Spaceport East]
This part of the spaceport has a fresh new look. Numerous pilot services are
available from the facilities here, including from the new Unreality Programming
office to the south, where a bold green and white banner announces: 'Employment
Opportunities! Apply inside!' Next to it, the spaceport's ship store competes
with a brand new flashing sign reading: 'Ship Sales! Don't be grounded!' Between
them, nearly hidden behind a potted plant is a wide stairway leading downward to
a lower level of the spaceport. A small sign near the stairway reads: Aerial
Fortresses and Supply. Other areas of interest here are the Fund Center to the
northwest, the pawn shop to the north, and the trading center to the northeast.
You see a trash can here.

Subject: League asylum for AEU citizens
Author: Tanny Hill
Posted: 02:05 19 September 2317 GST
--
Given the development of recent events, I would like the League to offer asylum
to any AEU citizens wishing to flee from Best and his regime. I myself am
willing to offer free transport to anyone wishing to escape the AEU.
--

on it.

[The Torus; Garage]
You can go up.
l
[The Torus; Garage]
The Torus's large garage is mostly empty but is surely as clean as it was on the
day of its construction. Not a drop of machine oil spoils the gleaming pale gray
metal of the deck, and the walls and ceiling are spotlessly clean. No ordinary
lights provide llumination here, beyond the work lanterns of the mechanics who
come in and out seeing after the starships, but rather the gray metal of the
structure seems to glow of its own accord.
You can go up.

ftl chetumal
What was once a feature of interstellar geography is now the name of an
alliance, and the heart of Fringe space can be found past this gateway. The tiny
station of Nuevo Laredo stands guard here.
The planet of Chetumal floats before you here, the richest planet among the
Fringe Worlds, although that isn't saying a lot.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Chetumal in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation order
is entered."

Subject: Re: League asylum for AEU citizens
Author: Jacob Shields
Posted: 12:20 19 September 2317 GST
--
I will have to see where all of this is going. the last thing I want to do is
leave my brothers and sisters in arms because I don't like something. But if we
all do this together and work with each other it could work. Then I might
consider the offer. But as of right now I want to wait a bit and see how things
develop. No use in self-destructing the ship if you only have one turret that
can't be repaired, is there?

Subject: Re: League asylum for AEU citizens
Author: Melinda Michaels
Posted: 14:28 19 September 2317 GST
--
Right so, while it would be grand to take all the good AEU people in, something
like this would have to be done through our political channels. It's probably an
idea you'd want to discuss with government officials. Especially if you are
wanting to do it in massive numbers. While I believe anybody can ask for asylum,
it is up to the government whether to grant it or not.

You glance at your communicator's screen.

l
[Starship "Deadly Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, a small hot beverage
dispenser, a small hot coffee dispenser, and an overstuffed dark green chair
here.
You can go east, southeast, and out.
(You are sitting on an overstuffed dark green chair.)
sit chair
You're already sitting.

from the various starship systems.

tra ta On my way

ftl chetumal
A metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator beeps quietly, indicating that it
has unread notices.
What was once a feature of interstellar geography is now the name of an
alliance, and the heart of Fringe space can be found past this gateway. The tiny
station of Nuevo Laredo stands guard here.
[Tactical Communication] Tobias Hawthorne transmits, "What is going on?"
[Tactical Communication] Evenia Callseah transmits, "Damien you're flying
though. I can't fly against all that."
The planet of Chetumal floats before you here, the richest planet among the
Fringe Worlds, although that isn't saying a lot.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Chetumal in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation order
is entered."
Via general sector communication, Chetumal transmits, "Greetings, Deadly Strike!
Welcome to Chetumal Orbit!"

 You are wearing a short-sleeved navy and white madras plaid cotton shirt, a

sneakers. Underneath this, you are wearing a pair of white cotton briefs and a
pair of white socks. You are also wearing a keychain, a backpack, a metallic
gold touch einrophone in a black leather phone holster, a solid silver ring
engraved with dolphins, and a gold wrist-mounted chronometer. You are concealing
a metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator, a flight control scanner, a
large expandable telescoping xenology container, a scorched metal thigh holster,
a golden Feng Wo coin purse, a camera bag, a black engineering tool case, a
black flightbag with a red shooting star on the side, and a leather briefcase.
Your head, face, both eyes, neck, both elbows, both forearms, both wrists, and
both hands are left uncovered.
You are carrying nothing.

landed on the planet Chetumal.

[Chetumal Spaceport; Pilot Lounge]
You see a gleaming granite-topped bar, a public holovid, a brightly-lit candy
vending machine, a trash can emblazoned with the triumphant image of Space Chief
Marshal Nina Thomas, and a brightly-colored educational poster here.
You can go out.
wave
You wave.
peer out
You peer out...
[Chetumal Spaceport; Landing Pad]
Carved out of the top of one of the old mountains north of Chetumal City, the
landing pad of this spaceport has an unmatched panoramic view of the
countryside. A low cliff shelters it on the north side, with mail, security, and
repair facilities built into it, and recent construction efforts have expanded
the area and given it a sleek new look. The pad itself consists of a patchwork
of heavy plasteel panels bordered by beams of lighted steel, the panels
variously sized to accommodate any model of starship, no matter how large or
small. A modern but somewhat noisy hydraulic system moves starships between the
landing pad and the garage below. On the south side of the pad is the pilot
lounge with large, tinted windows overlooking the fine Chetumalian landscape to
the south. You can GO into its sleek glass-framed doorway. There is also a
doorway here marked 'Liaison Office,' which you can also GO into. A doorway to
the south leads to the Salvage Reclamation Project Center, and a wide metal
stairway leads down into lower levels of the spaceport.
There appear to be some people in the lounge.
The two-person flare "Deadly Strike" and the five-person torpedo boat "Prince Of
Pain" are landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine, a long row of cinder blocks, a trash can,
and Orby the security hoverbot here.
Rogue Pilot Eli Grey is standing here.
You can go north, northeast, south, northwest, and down.
out

[Starship "Brahms Away"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at Old Earth; Manhattan Spaceport.
You see a decoy beacon launcher and Orby the security hoverbot here.
Damien Alexander, Rogue Pilot Eli Grey, Erik Goodwin, Michael Kennedy, and
Morris Corlew are standing here.
You can go south and out.
Michael Kennedy meanders south.

[Starship "Brahms Away"; Weapons Room Three]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. Lights overhead
indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is at Old Earth; Manhattan Spaceport.
You see a swiveling dark blue leather gunner's chair here.
You can go east.

[Old Earth; Manhattan Spaceport]
Welcome to Manhattan Spaceport! The entire place seems brand new, the glass
sparkling, the plasteel gleaming. Starships arrive and depart while others sit
on individual pads, rings of lights blinking around them as they are recharged.
Occasionally, the ground vibrates and the low rumble of heavy hydraulics is
heard as a starship is brought up from the underground garage or lowered for
extended parking below. Around the huge landing pad, wide, arched doorways
framed in brushed steel lead to various station services: Repair & Rearm to the
northeast, Supply to the southeast, Station Security to the southwest, and the
Mail Room to the northwest. In addition, a classy lighted sign over one doorway
reads, 'Pilot Lounge.' You can GO into it. There is also a doorway marked
'Liaison Office' that you can also GO into. Over the corridor to the south,
another sign reads 'Spaceport Exit and Express Train.'
There appear to be some people in the lounge.

and down.
